text: In this video we will talk about group by statement and having clause So let's understand what is group by statement So we can understand what is the use of group by statement So the values in your rows it groups the same values So for that we use group by statement So here you can see the definition The group by statement group the rows that have the same values into summary rows So mostly group by statement is used with aggregate functions which we saw in previous video like count, max, min, sum, average So mostly group by statement is used with these functions So let's see its syntax First you select the column name So here you can select more than one column From table name After that you write group by And the column names that you have put in select condition which you have selected you have to write that in group by So as you can see in example We wrote select mod After that we wrote sum So we run the aggregate function So you can see we have selected mod in group by Because it is coming in select statement So that column will come in group by So let's go to SQL and practice it So again we have payment table And there are 4 columns Customer ID, Amount, Mode and Payment Date So let me explain these 4 columns Customer ID is customer's ID Payment amount is how much amount you have paid And mode will tell you from which mode you have made the transaction You have given cash, credit card, debit card Or from which medium you have transferred money And last you have transferred money to which date So here we put group by So here I write So the example we saw Let's do it first After that I said let's sum Amount And I say this as total And after this Let me show you what is the need of group by So you can see If I don't use group by So you can see error will come So you can see I run it So it will get angry Now it is saying you have not used group by clause Because you are using aggregate function So you can see So if such error is coming It means you have to use group by Which is very important So column name will be mode So why is column name mode Because we have selected mode So we have selected mode And we want our data to be grouped by mode What was mode Different medium So let's run it So you can see According to mode column It is grouped by And we said sum So it has summed the amount So we have to write total So it defines column name Temporary name For this query So you can see total is here So from mobile payment 120 rupees Value has been transferred From net banking 90 From debit card 90 Spelling of card is wrong So sorry for that And credit card is 200 And cash is 220 To make it easy What we can do We can see it with order by So order by I say ASC But order by you have to do from Total So we have made a column Order it from this I will make it small Now let's run it So you can see Data is sorted Minimum value is at top And minimum value is at bottom So when data is read by other It is easy to understand So what you can understand Net banking has the lowest transaction And highest transaction is through cash Generally we see Online payment In India, people prefer cash Cash on delivery So this is our group by clause Here some people say How to decide column So here It is a childish point But I will tell you Select everything from payment And I have to run this line Only So now you can see My data is here Now I have taken Group by mod Now you think Why not group by customer id So the reason is You want to group by The one which has Repeated values Only then it will be grouped Customer id is unique It is not repeated So I can't group it And if you do Like I write Customer underscore id Copy it Who will write it again and again And paste it Now see what will happen If I run it Now total is 15 rows Now 15 will come And order by I have said Ascending total Now you see If you see total number of rows Now 15 is coming So it is not useful So whenever we use group by Then for that In which same group is being created In which group is being created Then we use group by statement Now let's see The condition you will use So let's see what is having clause So if you remember In select statement whenever you want to put a condition We use where clause for that So when you want to put a condition With group by, then we use having And having is made So that SQL language Doesn't get confused That you are putting having condition For select statement or group by That's why Where clause is with select And having is with group by So that's why two different clauses are made So you can see the definition Having clause is used to apply filter On the results of group by And it is based on the specification Means whatever condition you can put And then you can see Where clause is used for select statement And having clause Is used for group by When we put condition You can see the syntax Everything will be same in group by And in last, having and condition will come Select column From table You can put where condition After that group by And in last having And condition Remember that having condition will come after group by Don't put it above group by Or it will not execute You can see the example Let's run this example in SQL So we are again on our payment table And we are doing the same That we used in group by We are applying having clause So what we said in having That we are taking out count Last time we took out sum So this time we want to get count of amount We have to take out count of amount And then we have to put condition on it So let's do one thing Let's comment this first Leave it First let's run this Let's run So you can see what is count Means I have done payment three times Means I got money from it I have done it twice from net banking I have done it twice from debit card I have done it four times from credit card and four times from cash So this is the count Now What I want to say by applying having clause That I want to get count of Count which is More than three If someone has done less than three Then I don't want that So now you can see These two are net banking and debit card Which have less than three So these two will not come Now we will get only three output Let's run this Now you can see you have only three output First is credit card which has four transactions Second is cash which has four transactions Count is four And then there is mobile payment Count is three So this way we use having clause And along with having clause If you want to apply multiple condition I will say like this Equals to Two And I will copy the same thing And I want This thing to be Less than four Okay I want less than four But I also want more than two Now let's run this So now you can see it is giving three and two value It is giving less than four So now we have mobile payment, net banking and credit card Spelling of card is wrong So this way You can use having clause So here you can apply multiple function Like we were applying multiple conditions in where clause Sorry Like this You can apply multiple conditions here By using operators So this and and or These are all operators And one more thing If I put this on group by Then SQL will get angry And it will give you this output In error So now I will run it So now you can see Everything is same Just put having on group by Now I will run it Syntax error is there And it is telling on group by that there is an error So the having clause Will be used after group by So finally we have covered group by and having clause So here I am giving you in first assignment Which will be done very soon It is a small assignment And that question is Order of execution in SQL So the clauses I have given you Select, from, where and all So I have to tell you In which sequence it will be executed So you can tell me in comment And one thing you have to remember Don't cheat Try it by yourself So whether it is right or wrong You can tell me in comment section So I can know how many people are watching this video So see you in next video Bye Bye
